node.title: Shopping for Credenzas
node.alt: Once you find a credenza that suits your needs, you can style it with art, accessories and plants. (The Perforated Metal Buffet is about $1,500 at West Elm.)
node.description: Whether you need a place to put the food and drinks on Thanksgiving or a platform for your TV, a credenza comes in handy.
node.content: ["A credenza is a multitalented piece of furniture. It can hold fine china or stereo components. It can serve as a platform for a television or a tray with bar supplies. It\u2019s also a good place to put Thanksgiving platters piled high with food.", "\u201cEveryone likes them for storage, and for serving,\u201d said Raili Clasen, an interior designer in Newport Beach, Calif. \u201cIf you\u2019re having a party, it\u2019s a great flat surface.\u201d", "The only downside? The design of many credenzas is uninspired.", "\u201cThey\u2019re just blocky pieces of furniture,\u201d Ms. Clasen said, that take up a lot of space without adding much decorative appeal. \u201cI only like them when they add some design.\u201d", "One option is to look for a credenza with an unexpected shape, finish or details. Another is to focus on styling your credenza with art, accessories and plants.", "\u201cMore important than the credenza is what we do in the space around it,\u201d Ms. Clasen said. \u201cOn the sides and the wall above it.\u201d", "Whitewashed acacia wood credenza with antique-copper-finish doors", "Wood credenza with powder-coated steel base, flip-down doors and drawers", "Wood cabinet with glass doors by Neri&Hu", "Solid oak or walnut credenza with sliding doors and drawers", "Powder-coated steel credenza with engineered-wood top"]
